customerPersona.name: Bat-Erdene Bold
customerPersona.background: A former investment analyst with over 10 years of experience in the Mongolian financial sector and an MBA from a top-tier international university. He returned to Mongolia to modernize the local investment landscape by leveraging community-driven fintech solutions.
goals: Maximize the conversion rate of visitors into active mobile app users
Establish Negdi as the most trusted brand for retail micro-investing in Mongolia
Streamline the user education process to explain social investing in under 30 seconds
painPoints: The existing digital presence lacks the 'wow factor' needed to compete with established banks
High friction in the user onboarding funnel leading to significant drop-offs before app installation
Difficulty in balancing a professional financial aesthetic with a modern, approachable tech brand
successMetrics: 20% increase in app store click-through rate from the landing page
Reduction in bounce rate for mobile-first visitors
Positive feedback from potential Series A investors regarding brand positioning
customerPersona.communicationStyle: Direct and results-oriented; prefers high-level strategic updates via email and data-driven progress reports on a weekly basis.

userPersonas.name: Anar Battulga
userPersonas.background: A recent university graduate living in Ulaanbaatar who has just started her first full-time job. She is eager to build financial independence but finds traditional banking products boring and intimidating.
goals: Start investing with small amounts of spare change (under 20,000 MNT)
Learn how the stock market works through a simple, non-technical interface
Protect her monthly savings from the high inflation rates in Mongolia
frustrations: Traditional brokerage firms require too much paperwork and high initial deposits
Financial jargon makes her feel like she isn't smart enough to invest
Most investment platforms look outdated and are difficult to use on a smartphone
behaviors: Spends 4+ hours a day on social media (Instagram and TikTok)
Uses QPay or SocialPay for almost every purchase
Likely to sign up for a service if recommended by a trusted influencer
accessibility: Requires high-contrast UI for readability while commuting on bright buses

userPersonas.name: Ganbat Sukhbaatar
userPersonas.background: A father of two who has traditionally relied on savings accounts. He is skeptical of 'get rich quick' schemes and digital-only apps but is looking for better returns than what commercial banks offer.
goals: Verify the legal legitimacy and partnership status of the platform
Set up a long-term 'set-and-forget' investment plan for his children's education
Easily withdraw funds in case of a family emergency
frustrations: Lack of transparency regarding fees and commissions
Difficulty finding physical office addresses or official licenses on fintech websites
Complicated navigation that hides the 'Withdraw' button
behaviors: Checks the 'About Us' and 'FAQ' sections before even looking at the product
Prefers reading detailed articles or terms of service on a larger screen
accessibility: Needs adjustable font sizes and clear, large buttons

userPersonas.name: Saruul Zorig
userPersonas.background: An early adopter of fintech who already uses international apps like Binance or Robinhood but wants a local solution tailored to the Mongolian market and local stocks/funds.
goals: Access a diversified portfolio of Mongolian assets in one click
Automate monthly deposits directly from his salary account
Track real-time performance and portfolio growth via a clean dashboard
frustrations: Slow transaction processing times between local banks and investment accounts
Apps that don't support biometric login (FaceID/Fingerprint)
Lack of advanced data visualization for his portfolio distribution
behaviors: Optimizes his finances for efficiency and automation
Shares referral links with his tech-savvy colleagues to earn bonuses
Frequently toggles between light and dark modes depending on the time of day
accessibility: Prefers dark mode to reduce eye strain during night-time usage

userStories.title: Hero Section App Download
userStories.story: As Anar Battulga, I want to see clear 'Download App' buttons immediately upon landing on the page so that I can install the application without searching for it.
acceptanceCriteria: Given the user is on a mobile device, when they view the hero section, then they see the App Store (iOS) and Play Store (Android) badges.
Given the user clicks a store badge, when the action triggers, then they are redirected to the specific Negdi app page on the respective store.
Given the user is on the hero section, when the page loads, then the primary headline clearly mentions investing with as little as 'spare change'.
Given the user views the hero image, when displayed, then it shows a high-quality mockup of the mobile app interface.

userStories.title: Regulatory & Partner Verification
userStories.story: As Ganbat Sukhbaatar, I want to see the logos of partner banks and the Financial Regulatory Commission (FRC) license number so that I can verify Negdi is a legal entity before depositing money.
acceptanceCriteria: Given the footer or a dedicated 'Trust' section, when viewed, then the logo of the custodial bank/clearing partner is clearly visible.
Given the legal section, when viewed, then the specific FRC license number and company registration number are displayed as text.
Given a user clicks on the legal disclaimer, when the action occurs, then they are linked to the official FRC website or a PDF of the license.
Given the trust section, when loaded, then a statement regarding asset separation (custodian accounts) is visible.

userStories.title: Micro-Investing Mechanism Explainer
userStories.story: As Anar Battulga, I want to see a visual step-by-step guide on how 'spare change' investing works so that I understand how small daily transactions turn into investments.
acceptanceCriteria: Given the 'How it Works' section, when viewed, then there is a visual graphic showing a transaction (e.g., Coffee 5,500 MNT) being rounded up to 6,000 MNT.
Given the graphic, when the animation or flow completes, then it highlights the 500 MNT difference moving into an investment portfolio.
Given the explanation text, when read, then it avoids complex financial jargon and uses simple Mongolian terms.
Given the section bottom, when reached, then a 'Start with 20,000 MNT' CTA button is displayed.

userStories.title: Desktop to Mobile QR Bridge
userStories.story: As Saruul Zorig, I want to see a QR code when browsing the landing page on my laptop so that I can quickly download the app on my phone without typing the URL manually.
acceptanceCriteria: Given the user is browsing on a desktop viewport (>1024px), when the page loads, then a dynamic QR code is visible in the navigation bar or hero section.
Given the user scans the QR code with a mobile camera, when scanned, then the device opens a dynamic link that routes to the correct app store based on OS.
Given the user is on a mobile device (<768px), when the page loads, then the QR code element is hidden to save screen space.
Given the QR code section, when hovered, then a tooltip text 'Scan to Download' appears.

userStories.title: Portfolio Asset Diversification View
userStories.story: As Saruul Zorig, I want to see a breakdown of the asset classes (Mongolian stocks, bonds, funds) available in the app so that I know my portfolio will be diversified.
acceptanceCriteria: Given the 'Features' section, when scrolled to, then a pie chart or list visualizes the asset mix (e.g., Top 20 MSE stocks, Government Bonds).
Given the asset list, when interactively hovered or tapped, then brief details about the return potential (ROI) for that asset class appear.
Given the portfolio description, when read, then it mentions 'One-click diversification' as a key benefit.
Given the UI, when displayed, then it clarifies that the user owns fractional shares of these assets.

userStories.title: Data Security & Encryption Info
userStories.story: As Ganbat Sukhbaatar, I want to read about the security measures protecting my personal data so that I feel safe linking my bank account.
acceptanceCriteria: Given the 'Security' section, when viewed, then it displays icons representing SSL encryption and Bank-grade security standards.
Given the content, when read, then it explicitly states that Negdi does not store bank login credentials directly.
Given the security badges, when clicked, then they provide a brief tooltip or modal explaining the specific security standard.
Given the privacy policy link, when clicked, then it opens a readable summary of how user data is processed.

userStories.title: Automated Deposit Feature Highlight
userStories.story: As Saruul Zorig, I want to understand the 'Set and Forget' automation features so that I can plan my monthly salary deductions.
acceptanceCriteria: Given the Features section, when viewing 'Automation', then it illustrates the concept of recurring deposits (e.g., Monthly Salary -> Auto Invest).
Given the description, when read, then it clarifies that users can pause or change the amount at any time.
Given the visual aid, when viewed, then it shows a calendar icon or a timeline of growth over 12 months.
Given the section CTA, when clicked, then it deep-links to the automation setup tutorial (or app download if not installed).

userStories.title: FAQ & Support Access
userStories.story: As Ganbat Sukhbaatar, I want to find answers to common questions about withdrawals and fees so that I am not surprised by hidden costs later.
acceptanceCriteria: Given the FAQ accordion, when the 'Fees' question is expanded, then a clear table of fees (subscription vs transaction) is displayed.
Given the 'Withdrawal' question, when expanded, then it explains the timeline (e.g., T+2 days) for getting money back into the bank account.
Given the user cannot find an answer, when they look at the bottom right, then a 'Contact Support' or Chat bubble is available.
Given the support link, when clicked, then it opens the Facebook Messenger integration or email client.

userStories.title: Social Proof & Statistics
userStories.story: As Anar Battulga, I want to see the number of active users or total MNT invested so that I feel confident that others are successfully using the platform.
acceptanceCriteria: Given the 'Community' section, when viewed, then a counter shows 'X,XXX Active Users' or 'X Billion MNT Invested'.
Given the statistics, when displayed, then they are rounded numbers that update periodically (not real-time streaming).
Given the section design, when viewed, then it includes 2-3 short testimonials from users similar to Anar (students/young professionals).
Given the testimonials, when read, then they highlight the ease of use or the 'spare change' feature.

userStories.title: Sticky Mobile Download CTA
userStories.story: As Anar Battulga, I want a 'Download App' button to remain visible while I scroll down the page on my phone so that I can convert the moment I am convinced.
acceptanceCriteria: Given the user scrolls past the hero section on mobile, when the scroll event triggers, then a sticky bar appears at the bottom or top of the viewport.
Given the sticky bar, when viewed, then it contains a prominent 'Get App' button.
Given the button, when clicked, then it uses the same dynamic routing logic as the hero buttons (Story ST-001).
Given the user is on a desktop, when scrolling, then the sticky bar is either hidden or replaced by a sticky header navigation with a download button.
